availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Irwin Bullock (Fulton and Hickman County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Fulton and Hickman County, Kentucky, attorney. Virginia native. Married to Maria Bullock. Father of John M. Bullock, Harriett A. Bullock, Hettie T. Bullock, Thomas E. Bullock, Cara P. Bullock, and Mary Bullock. Graduate of William and Mary College. Attorney in Hickman, Fulton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Fulton County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, Hickman, p. 112B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 917.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 489.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 202A.
William Elsey Connelley, History of Kentucky vol. 5 (Lousiville: American Historical Society, 1922), 35.
